name: vscord
description: Highly customizable Discord Rich Presence extenstion for Visual Studio Code
author: LeonardSSH <leonardssh22@gmail.com> (https://leonard.sh)

commands.title: Enable Discord Presence in the current workspace
Disable Discord Presence in the current workspace
Reconnect Discord Presence to Discord Gateway

vscord.app.id.description: Application id that will be used when `appName` is "custom" or when `appName` is invalid

vscord.app.name.description:
Choose the name you want the application to use.
Choosing "Custom" will make it so it use the "rpc.id" as application id

vscord.status.showElapsedTime.description: Show elapsed time in the details section of the rich presence.

vscord.status.resetElapsedTimePerFile.description: If true, the elapsed time will be reset when you switch files.

vscord.status.problems.enabled.description: Show the number of problems in the status.

vscord.status.problems.text.description: The text to show in the status when there are problems. {problems_count} will be replaced with the number of problems.

vscord.status.idle.check.description: Check if the user is idle or not.

vscord.status.idle.disconnectOnIdle.description: Disconnects from Discord when the user is idle.

vscord.status.idle.resetElapsedTime.description: Resets the elapsed time when the user becomes idle.

vscord.status.idle.timeout.description: Time in seconds before the user is considered idle.

vscord.ignore.workspaces.description: List of workspace names to ignore.

vscord.ignore.workspacesText.description: The text to show when the workspace is ignored.

vscord.ignore.organizations.description: Ignore all repositories from the specified organizations.

vscord.ignore.gitHosts.description: Ignore all repositories from the specified git hosts.

vscord.status.details.enabled.description: Controls if the Discord Rich Presence should show across all workspaces.

vscord.status.details.idle.enabled.description: Controls if the Discord Rich Presence should show when the user is idle.

vscord.status.details.text.idle.description:
Custom string for the details section of the rich presence when editing
	- {app_name} will be replaced with current editor name.
	- {app_id} will be replaced with editor name that's suitable for using inside url.
	- {file_name} will be replaced with the name of the file
	- {file_extenstion} will be replaced with the extension of the file
	- {file_size} will be replaced with the size of the file
	- {folder_and_file} will be replaced with the folder and file name
	- {full_directory_name} will be replaced with the full directory name
	- {workspace} will be replaced with the name of the workspace
	- {workspace_folder} will be replaced with the name of the workspace folder
	- {workspace_and_folder} will be replaced with the name of the workspace and folder
	- {LANG} or {Lang} or {LANG} will replace the format of the lang string
	- {problems} will be replaced with the problems text defined in settings
	- {problems_count} will be replaced with the number of problems
	- {line_count} will be replaced with the number of lines
	- {current_line} will be replaced with the current line
	- {current_column} will be replaced with the current column
	- {git_url} will be replaced with the link to current git repository.
	- {git_owner} will be replaced with current git repository owner.
	- {git_provider} will be replaced with the domain (including .com) to the provider of current git repository.
	- {git_repo} will be replaced with the repository name for current repository.
	- {git_branch} will be replaced with current git branch.
	- {empty} will be replaced with an empty space.

vscord.status.image.small.idle.key.description: The key of the small image when idling.

vscord.status.image.small.idle.text.description: Custom string for the small image text when idling

vscord.status.image.small.viewing.text.description:
Custom string for the small image text when viewing
	- {app_name} will be replaced with the name of the app
	- {app_id} will be replaced with the id of the app

vscord.status.image.small.editing.key.description: The url to the image when editing, {app_id} will be replaced with the file extension of the file.

vscord.status.image.small.editing.text.description: Custom string for the small image text of the rich presence when editing

vscord.status.image.small.debugging.key.description: The url to the image when debugging. {app_id} will be replaced with the file extension of the file.

vscord.status.image.small.debugging.text.description: Custom string for the small image text of the rich presence when debugging

vscord.status.button.enabled.description: Enable or disable the status button.

vscord.status.button.active.enabled.description: If disabled, the button will be hidden when the user is active.

vscord.status.button.active.label.description: The label of the button when the user is viewing a file from a repository.

vscord.status.button.active.url.description: The active url for the button

vscord.status.button.idle.enabled.description: Enable button when user is idle.

vscord.status.button.idle.label.description: The label of the button when the user is idle.

vscord.status.button.idle.url.description: The button Idle url when the user is idle.

vscord.status.button.inactive.enabled.description: Show a button when the user is not viewing a file.

vscord.status.button.inactive.label.description: The label of the button when the user is inactive.

vscord.file.size.round.description: The number of decimal places to round the file size to.

vscord.file.size.spacer.description: Spacer between the number and the unit.

vscord.behaviour.suppressNotifications.description: Suppresses all notifications from the extension.

vscord.behavoiur.prioritizeLanguagesOver.description: Prioritize languages over extensions when determining the file type.

vscord.file.size.humanReadable.description: If true, the file size will be displayed in a human readable format (e.g. 1.2 MB). If false, the file size will be displayed in bytes.

vscord.file.size.standard.description: The unit standard to use when displaying the file size.
